ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Classes and functions to work with biological sequences (DNA, RNA and amino acid sequences). Implements S3 infrastructure to work with biological sequences as described in Keck (2020) <doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13490>. Provides a collection of functions to perform biological conversion among classes (transcription, translation) and basic operations on sequences (detection, selection and replacement based on positions or patterns). The package also provides functions to import and export sequences from and to other package formats.

Classes and functions to work with biological sequences (DNA, RNA and amino acid sequences). Implements S3 infrastructure to work with biological sequences as described in Keck (2020) <doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13490>. Provides a collection of functions to perform biological conversion among classes (transcription, translation) and basic operations on sequences (detection, selection and replacement based on positions or patterns). The package also provides functions to import and export sequences from and to other package formats.

name: r-bioseq
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.1.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-bioseq
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/bioseq_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/bioseq/bioseq_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 4ee23adb2ba67e42620c1db0f22ecf7692f0f944c81c88b9f48af6397653286e

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ape
    - r-crayon
    - r-dplyr
    - r-pillar
    - r-readr
    - r-rlang
    - r-stringdist
    - r-stringi
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble
    - r-vctrs
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ape
    - r-crayon
    - r-dplyr
    - r-pillar
    - r-readr
    - r-rlang
    - r-stringdist
    - r-stringi
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble
    - r-vctrs

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('bioseq')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('bioseq')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://fkeck.github.io/bioseq/
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Classes and functions to work with biological sequences (DNA, RNA and amino acid sequences). Implements S3 infrastructure to work with biological sequences as described in Keck (2020) <doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13490>. Provides a collection of functions to perform biological conversion among classes (transcription,
    translation) and basic operations on sequences (detection, selection and replacement based on positions or patterns). The package also provides functions to import and export sequences from and to other package formats.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ColineRoyaux
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: bioseq
# Type: Package
# Title: A Toolbox for Manipulating Biological Sequences
# Version: 0.1.4
# Authors@R: c(person(given = "Francois", family = "Keck", role = c("aut", "cre", "cph"), email = "francois.keck@gmail.com", comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-3323-4167")) )
# Maintainer: Francois Keck <francois.keck@gmail.com>
# Description: Classes and functions to work with biological sequences (DNA, RNA and amino acid sequences). Implements S3 infrastructure to work with biological sequences as described in Keck (2020) <doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13490>. Provides a collection of functions to perform biological conversion among classes (transcription, translation) and basic operations on sequences (detection, selection and replacement based on positions or patterns). The package also provides functions to import and export sequences from and to other package formats.
# License: GPL-3
# URL: https://fkeck.github.io/bioseq/
# BugReports: https://github.com/fkeck/bioseq/issues
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# Depends: R (>= 3.1.0)
# Imports: methods, vctrs, tibble, ape, crayon, dplyr, pillar, stringi, stringr, stringdist, readr, rlang
# Suggests: knitr, rmarkdown, testthat (>= 2.1.0), covr
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2022-08-12 12:49:49 UTC; ecoadmin
# Author: Francois Keck [aut, cre, cph] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3323-4167>)
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2022-09-06 11:40:18 UTC
